intro: Sciodaphyllum chachapoyense, commonly known as the Chachapoyan sun-leaf, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the cloud forests of northern Peru. It belongs to the family Podostomata, which includes aquatic and semi-aquatic plants typically found in fast-flowing streams. The plant is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, with broad, flat leaves that float on the water surface. It plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for microorganisms and small aquatic life. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, it is considered critically endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
